info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 25 at 10:28PM CDT until June 26 at 4:30AM CDT by NWS Hastings NE
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Portions of central and south central Nebraska, including the following counties, in central Nebraska, Howard and Merrick. In south central Nebraska, Hall.
* WHEN...Until 430 AM CDT Thursday.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1024 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated ongoing heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the Advisory area. Between 1 and 4 inches of rain have already fallen across much of the Advisory area Wednesday, with another 1 to 2 inches possible overnight into early Thursday morning. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Beaver Creek, Moores Creek, Prairie Creek, Prairie Slough, Warm Slough, Silver Creek and Flat Creek.
- Some locations that could experience flooding include... Grand Island, Wood River, Alda and St. Libory. - Some degree of street flooding is likely in Grand Island. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 AM CDT THURSDAY

area.areaDesc: Hall, NE; Howard, NE; Merrick, NE
